title: CollabForge MVP: Creative profiles, quiz-based matching, and project-based collaboration

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and a first-run onboarding flow that creates a user account record and routes new users to set up their Creative Profile.

quotes: A skill-matching collaboration app for artists, singers, coders, and writers

acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated visitors see a clear call-to-action to sign in with Internet Identity.
After successful sign-in, the backend has a user record keyed by the caller principal.
New users are taken to an onboarding/profile setup screen; returning users are taken to their dashboard.

requirements.text: Create Creative Profile data model and CRUD: display name, bio, skill tags (multi-select), skill level, genres/styles (multi-select), goals (multi-select), availability, mood/vibe tags, inspirations (free-form list), portfolio links (typed URL list), and a ‚ÄúLooking for‚Äù text section.

quotes: Skill tags (Singer, Producer, Coder, Writer, Illustrator, etc.)
Portfolio links (SoundCloud, GitHub, ArtStation, Google Drive)

acceptanceCriteria: Users can create/update their own profile and view other users‚Äô profiles.
Profile fields support multiple selections where applicable (skills/genres/goals/vibes).
Portfolio links can be added/removed and are validated as URLs on the frontend.
Backend enforces that only the profile owner can edit their profile.

requirements.text: Build a Creative Profile Quiz that collects matching inputs (experience/skill level, genres/styles, goals, availability, mood/vibe, inspirations) and stores quiz answers for use in matching.

quotes: Users answer a creative profile quiz

acceptanceCriteria: Quiz can be completed and re-taken; latest answers are persisted.
Quiz answers are visible/editable from a settings/profile area.
If a user has not completed the quiz, they are prompted to do so before seeing match suggestions.

requirements.text: Implement ‚ÄúSmart Matching‚Äù suggestions: generate a ranked list of collaborator suggestions using quiz/profile overlap (skills, genres/styles, goals, availability, vibe/inspirations) and show a dating-style swipe/like-pass UI that records likes and passes.

quotes: The app suggests collaborators like a dating app‚Äîbut for creativity.

acceptanceCriteria: A user can browse suggested collaborators in a card-based UI and choose Like or Pass.
Likes/Passes are persisted and the same candidate is not repeatedly suggested once decided.
Suggestions are ranked and explainable at a basic level (e.g., show top shared tags such as genres/goals/vibes) in the UI.
Backend prevents a user from liking/passing themselves.

requirements.text: Add Project-based discovery: users can create project postings with title, description, category (album/game/comic/novel/etc.), genres/styles, vibe tags, goals, timeline/availability, roles needed (structured list), and optional external links; users can browse, filter, and view project details.

quotes: ‚ÄúNeed a writer for fantasy visual novel‚Äù

acceptanceCriteria: Signed-in users can create/edit/archive their own projects.
All users can browse a project feed and open a project detail page.
Project feed supports basic filtering by roles needed and genres/styles (at minimum).
Archived projects no longer appear in the default feed.

requirements.text: Implement project applications and invitations: users can apply to a project with a message and chosen role; project owners can review applicants, accept/reject, and optionally invite specific users to apply/join.
acceptanceCriteria: A user can submit an application to a project and see its status (pending/accepted/rejected).
Project owners can list applicants and accept or reject each application.
Project owners can send an invitation to a specific user; invited users can accept/decline.
Backend authorization ensures only the project owner can manage applications/invitations for that project.

requirements.text: Provide collaboration spaces for accepted collaborators per project, including: a simple task board (To do / Doing / Done) and an async message board (text-only) for project communication.
acceptanceCriteria: Only project members (owner + accepted collaborators) can view and post in the project collaboration space.
Task board supports creating tasks, moving tasks across columns, assigning to members (optional), and marking complete via column state.
Message board supports posting messages and viewing message history in chronological order.
UI updates reliably using client-side polling/refresh (no WebSockets required).

requirements.text: Add optional collaboration history and ratings (minimal MVP): after a project is marked completed by the owner, members can rate each other on communication, reliability, and skill accuracy, and view received ratings summary on profiles.
acceptanceCriteria: Project owner can mark a project as completed.
After completion, project members can submit one rating per collaborator per project with the three criteria.
Profiles show an aggregate summary (e.g., averages/counts) and a list of completed collaborations (minimal).
Users cannot rate non-collaborators or rate outside a completed project context.

requirements.text: Create core app navigation and pages: Landing (marketing + sign-in), Dashboard (matches + active projects), Profile (view/edit), Quiz, Matches (browse/like/pass), Projects (feed + create), Project Detail, Collaboration Space (tasks + messages), and Settings.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages are reachable via a consistent navigation pattern for signed-in users.
Anonymous users can access Landing and view limited marketing content but cannot access app features without signing in.
Routing does not break on refresh and has sensible empty/loading states.

requirements.text: Define a coherent visual theme for CollabForge and apply it consistently across the app (colors, typography, spacing, component style, and key interaction patterns). Avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: App uses a distinct, cohesive visual style across all pages (not default template styling).
Primary palette is not blue/purple.
Key components (cards, tags/chips, buttons, inputs) look consistent and intentional.

requirements.text: Generate and include essential static visual assets (logo + small UI illustrations) and render them in the UI (landing page and empty states) as static files served from the frontend.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
Landing page includes the logo asset.
At least one empty state (e.g., no matches / no projects) uses an illustration asset.

requirements.text: Add basic account and safety controls: ability to delete own account (soft-delete), and ability to report a user/project (store report records for admin review later; no admin UI required).

quotes: This app is about creative partnerships, not just gigs.

acceptanceCriteria: User can initiate account deletion; their profile becomes hidden from discovery/matches/projects going forward.
Users can submit a report against a user or a project with a reason and optional text.
Reports are persisted in the backend and retrievable via a backend method intended for future admin tooling.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (single-actor architecture).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other frontend immutablePaths; compose these components instead.
Do not use WebSockets or real-time socket-based chat; implement async messaging with polling/refresh.
Do not integrate third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity is supported.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Voice notes and real-time voice features.
Rich file sharing (large binary uploads/streaming) beyond basic URLs/links in MVP.
Paid monetization implementation (subscriptions, boosts, payment processing) in this MVP; only leave room in data model if needed.

required: CollabForge wordmark logo with subtle anvil/forge motif, clean modern style, transparent background (collabforge-logo.dim_1024x256.png)
Minimal illustration of diverse creative tools (mic, pen, code brackets, paintbrush) in a cohesive flat style (creative-tools-illustration.dim_1200x800.png)
Minimal empty-state illustration of two puzzle pieces or hands collaborating, flat style (collaboration-empty-state.dim_800x600.png)
